questions.explanation:
7. Have the machines on the factory floor been cleaned?
(A) No, not yet. → Correct (directly answers the question about cleaning status)
(B) It's in the shipping container. → Incorrect (refers to location, not cleaning)
(C) I just put it in the trash bin. → Incorrect (unrelated to machine cleaning)

8. How much will the budget increase next year?
(A) About 10 percent. → Correct (specifies the budget increase)
(B) Three hours, I think. → Incorrect (refers to time, not budget)
(C) At the bank's main branch. → Incorrect (refers to location, not budget)

9. You're going to water the plants before you leave, aren't you?
(A) I walked the whole way. → Incorrect (unrelated to watering plants)
(B) Yes, right after lunch. → Correct (confirms watering the plants)
(C) In the breakroom. → Incorrect (refers to location, not action)

10. Aren't you going to schedule an eye doctor appointment?
(A) Those glasses look nice on you. → Incorrect (unrelated to scheduling)
(B) I already scheduled one. → Correct (confirms scheduling action)
(C) The seminar is three days long. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

11. I'm going to try to fix this printer.
(A) You're right, it doesn't fit. → Incorrect (unrelated to fixing the printer)
(B) Double-sided copies. → Incorrect (refers to printer function, not repair)
(C) Are you sure it can be repaired? → Correct (directly addresses the repair attempt)

12. What should we do with these brochures?
(A) A trip to the seashore. → Incorrect (unrelated to brochures)
(B) Yes, I found it already. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) I'll leave them at the front desk. → Correct (specifies an action for the brochures)

13. Has the policy meeting been rescheduled?
(A) We have lots of desk calendar designs. → Incorrect (unrelated to rescheduling)
(B) Yes, it's happening tomorrow instead. → Correct (confirms rescheduling)
(C) This soup I ordered is delicious. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

14. Why don't we stop by the office cafeteria on our way to the workshop?
(A) Sure, we have time for that. → Correct (agrees to the suggestion)
(B) A full-service buffet. → Incorrect (describes the cafeteria, not agreement)
(C) The topic is professional networking. → Incorrect (refers to the workshop, not the cafeteria)

15. Have you tried our famous pasta dish?
(A) We need a table for five. → Incorrect (unrelated to trying the dish)
(B) Yes, it was delicious. → Correct (confirms trying the dish)
(C) I'll try to make it on time. → Incorrect (refers to timing, not the dish)

16. Who's the opening act at tonight's concert?
(A) Could you turn up the volume? → Incorrect (unrelated to the opening act)
(B) A jazz singer from France. → Correct (identifies the opening act)
(C) The position has been filled. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the concert)

17. When do the product demonstrations start?
(A) The schedule was e-mailed last Friday. → Correct (implies timing information)
(B) Some innovative features. → Incorrect (describes the product, not timing)
(C) In room 202, I think. → Incorrect (refers to location, not timing)

18. I tried updating the Web site, but it didn't work.
(A) That date works for me. → Incorrect (unrelated to website updates)
(B) Usually our online reviews. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the issue)
(C) Just send me the changes you want. → Correct (offers a solution)

19. Did you hire a new welding specialist?
(A) The part's back-ordered. → Incorrect (unrelated to hiring)
(B) Yes, he starts tomorrow. → Correct (confirms hiring)
(C) No, it should be higher. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

20. How was the color palette for the lobby chosen?
(A) Blue and orange. → Incorrect (describes colors, not the process)
(B) It was fine, thanks. → Incorrect (unrelated to the question)
(C) I wasn't involved. → Correct (addresses the selection process indirectly)

21. When are we ordering more supplies for the office?
(A) In the storage closet. → Incorrect (refers to location, not timing)
(B) Next week on Monday. → Correct (specifies the timing)
(C) The new desk looks great! → Incorrect (irrelevant to ordering)

22. The battery for the water pump is going to be solar powered, right?
(A) We're still in the planning stages. → Correct (addresses the status of the decision)
(B) A hundred and forty dollars per year. → Incorrect (refers to cost, not power source)
(C) Yes, I'd love a glass of water. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

23. Where can I buy a charger for this laptop?
(A) Around three o'clock. → Incorrect (refers to time, not purchase location)
(B) I can order one for you. → Correct (offers a purchasing solution)
(C) A limited return policy. → Incorrect (irrelevant to buying)

24. Do I need to reserve a meeting room?
(A) Yes, let me show you how. → Correct (confirms the need and offers help)
(B) The service is good. → Incorrect (unrelated to reserving a room)
(C) My slide presentation. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

25. When's the new department director supposed to start?
(A) It's an hour long. → Incorrect (refers to duration, not start date)
(B) Ms. Pavlova isn't retiring for several weeks. → Correct (implies start date indirectly)
(C) No, that department's upstairs. → Incorrect (refers to location, not timing)

26. Should I deliver these pizzas, or will you?
(A) No thanks-I'm not hungry. → Incorrect (unrelated to delivery)
(B) Ten dollars for two. → Incorrect (refers to cost, not delivery)
(C) They're being picked up. → Correct (indicates no delivery needed)

27. This month's shipment schedule has been revised.
(A) I couldn't find them either. → Incorrect (unrelated to the schedule)
(B) Which dates have been changed? → Correct (directly addresses the revision)
(C) Two dollars per pound. → Incorrect (refers to cost, not schedule)

28. How much will the repairs cost?
(A) The work is covered under the warranty plan. → Correct (addresses the cost)
(B) Yes, it's also available in red. → Incorrect (unrelated to repairs)
(C) In about two weeks. → Incorrect (refers to time, not cost)

29. Why don't we provide more samples of the wallpaper patterns?
(A) The newspaper is delivered daily. → Incorrect (unrelated to wallpaper samples)
(B) An interior design course. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) There are plenty in the binders. → Correct (explains why more samples aren't needed)

30. Can you give me a tour of the property this afternoon?
(A) Sorry, I won't have time until tomorrow. → Correct (directly addresses the tour request)
(B) It has a very modern design. → Incorrect (describes the property, not the tour)
(C) A house on Maple Street. → Incorrect (refers to location, not the tour)

31. Who's scheduled to test the product today?
(A) We're waiting for confirmation. → Correct (addresses the scheduling status)
(B) It's a great album, right? → Incorrect (unrelated to product testing)
(C) About six weeks ago. → Incorrect (refers to time, not the person)
